info2: 1: VDD and VDDA are below the PVD threshold set by PLS[2:0].
0: VDD and VDDA are above the PVD threshold set by PLS[2:0].

bits_fields.name: AWUWR[5:0]
bits_fields.info:
AWU window value: The AWU window value is equal to the input value of the AWU window value + 1; 
The AWU window value is used to compare with the up counter value. When the counter value is equal to the window value, a wake-up signal is generated.

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.info: Reserved

bits_fields.name: AWUPSC[3:0]
bits_fields.info: Counting time base.

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.info: Reserved

bits_fields.name: PLLRDY
bits_fields.info:
PLL clock-ready lock flag bit.
1: PLL clock lock.
0: PLL clock is not locked.

bits_fields.name: PLLON
bits_fields.info:
PLL clock enable control bit.
1: Enables the PLL clock.
0: Turn off the PLL clock.
Note: After entering Standby low-power mode, this bit is cleared by hardware to 0.

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.info: Reserved

bits_fields.name: CSSON
bits_fields.info:
Clock security system enable control bit.
1: Enable the clock security system. When HSE is ready (HSERDY set to 1), the hardware turns on the clock monitoring function of HSE and triggers CSSF flag and NMI interrupt when HSE is found to be abnormal; when HSE is not ready, the hardware turns off the clock monitoring function of HSE.
0: Turns off the clock security system.

bits_fields.name: HSEBYP
bits_fields.info:
External high-speed crystal bypass control bit.
1: Bypass external high-speed crystal/ceramic resonators (using an external clock source).
0: No bypass of high-speed external crystal/ceramic resonators.
Note: This bit needs to be written with HSEON at 0.

bits_fields.name: HSERDY
bits_fields.info:
External high-speed crystal oscillation stabilization ready flag bit (set by hardware).
1: Stable external high-speed crystal oscillation.
0: External high-speed crystal oscillation is not stabilized.
Note: After the HSEON bit is cleared to 0, it takes 6 HSE cycles for this bit to clear to 0.

bits_fields.name: HSEON
bits_fields.info:
External high-speed crystal oscillation enable control bit.
1: Enables the HSE oscillator.
0: Turn off the HSE oscillator.
Note: This bit is cleared to 0 by hardware after entering Standby low-power mode.

bits_fields.name: HSICAL
bits_fields.info: Internal high-speed clock calibration values, which are automatically initialized at system startup.

bits_fields.name: HSITRIM
bits_fields.info:
Internal high-speed clock adjustment value.
The user can enter an adjustment value to superimpose on the HSICAL[7:0] value to adjust the frequency of the internal HSI RC oscillator based on voltage and temperature variations.
The default value is 16, which can adjust the HSI to 24MHz ±1%; the change of HSICAL is adjusted about 60kHz per step.

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.info: Reserved

bits_fields.name: HSIRDY
bits_fields.info:
Internal high-speed clock (24MHz) Stable Ready flag bit (set by hardware).
1: The internal high-speed clock (24MHz) is stable;
0: The internal high-speed clock (24MHz) is not stable.
Note: After the HSION bit is cleared to 0, it takes 6 HSI cycles for the bit to be cleared to 0.

bits_fields.name: HSION
bits_fields.info:
Internal high-speed clock (24MHz) enable control bit.
1: Enable the HSI oscillator.
0: Disable the HSI oscillator.
Note: This bit is set to 1 by hardware to start the internal 24MHz RC oscillator when returning from standby mode or when the external oscillator HSE used as the system clock fails.

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.info: Reserved

bits_fields.name: MCO[2:0]
bits_fields.info:
Microcontroller MCO pin clock output control.
0xx: no clock output.
100: System clock (SYSCLK) output.
101: Internal 24 MHz RC oscillator clock (HSI) output.
110: External oscillator clock (HSE) output.
111: PLL clock output.

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.info: Reserved

bits_fields.name: PLLSRC
bits_fields.info:
Input clock source for PLL (write only when PLL is off).
1: HSE is fed into PLL without dividing the frequency.
0: HSI is not divided and sent to PLL.

bits_fields.name: ADCPRE[4:0]
bits_fields.info:
ADC clock source prescaler control {13:11,15:14}.
000xx: HBCLK divided by 2 as ADC clock.
010xx: HBCLK divided by 4 as ADC clock.
100xx: HBCLK divided by 6 as ADC clock.
110xx: HBCLK divided by 8 as ADC clock.
00100: HBCLK divided by 4 as ADC clock.
01100: HBCLK divided by 8 as ADC clock.
10100: HBCLK divided by 12 as ADC clock.
11100: HBCLK divided by 16 as ADC clock.
00101: HBCLK divided by 8 as ADC clock.
01101: HBCLK divided by 16 as ADC clock.
10101: HBCLK divided by 24 as ADC clock.
11101: HBCLK divided by 32 as ADC clock.
00110: HBCLK divided by 16 as ADC clock.
01110: HBCLK divided by 32 as ADC clock.
10110: HBCLK divided by 48 as ADC clock.
11110: HBCLK divided by 64 as ADC clock.
00111: HBCLK divided by 32 as ADC clock.
01111: HBCLK divided by 64 as ADC clock.
10111: HBCLK divided by 96 as ADC clock.
11111: HBCLK divided by 128 as ADC clock.
Note: The ADC clock should not exceed a maximum of 24MHz.

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.info: Reserved

bits_fields.name: HPRE[3:0]
bits_fields.info:
HB clock source prescaler control.
0000: Prescaler off.
0001: SYSCLK divided by 2.
0010: SYSCLK divided by 3.
0011: SYSCLK divided by 4.
0100: SYSCLK divided by 5.
0101: SYSCLK divided by 6.
0110: SYSCLK divided by 7.
0111: SYSCLK divided by 8.
1000: SYSCLK divided by 2.
1001: SYSCLK divided by 4.
1010: SYSCLK divided by 8.
1011: SYSCLK divided by 16.
1100: SYSCLK divided by 32.
1101: SYSCLK divided by 64.
1110: SYSCLK divided by 128.
1111: SYSCLK divided by 256.

bits_fields.name: SWS[1:0]
bits_fields.info:
System clock (SYSCLK) status (hardware set).
00: The system clock source is HSI.
01: The system clock source is HSE.
10: The system clock source is a PLL.
11: Not available.

bits_fields.name: SW[1:0]
bits_fields.info:
Select the system clock source.
00: HSI as system clock.
01: HSE as system clock.
10: PLL output as system clock.
11: Not available.
Note: With Clock Safe enabled (CSSON=1), HSI is forced by hardware to be selected as the system clock when returning from Standby and Stop mode or when the external oscillator HSE used as the system clock fails.

bits_fields.name: Reserved

bits_fields.name: LPWRRSTF
bits_fields.info:
Low-power reset flag.
1: Occurrence of low-power resets.
0: No low-power reset occurs.
Set to 1 by hardware when a low-power management reset occurs; cleared by software writing of the RMVF bit.

bits_fields.name: WWDGRSTF
bits_fields.info:
Window watchdog reset flag.
1: Occurrence of a window watchdog reset.
0: No window watchdog reset occurs.
Set to 1 by hardware when a window watchdog reset occurs; cleared by software writing of the RMVF bit.

bits_fields.name: IWDGRSTF
bits_fields.info:
Independent watchdog reset flag.
1: Occurrence of an independent watchdog reset.
0: No independent watchdog reset occurs.
Set to 1 by hardware when an independent watchdog reset occurs; cleared by software writing of the RMVF bit.

bits_fields.name: SFTRSTF
bits_fields.info:
Software reset flag.
1: Software reset occurs.
0: No software reset occurs.
Set to 1 by hardware when a software reset occurs; software write RMVF bit cleared.

bits_fields.name: PORRSTF
bits_fields.info:
Power-up/power-down reset flag.
1: Power-up/power-down reset occurs.
0: No power-up/power-down reset occurs.
Set to 1 by hardware when power-up/power-down reset occurs; cleared by software writing of RMVF bit.

bits_fields.name: PINRSTF
bits_fields.info:
External manual reset (NRST pin) flag.
1: Occurrence of NRST pin reset.
0: No NRST pin reset occurs.
Set to 1 by hardware when NRST pin reset occurs; cleared by software writing of RMVF bit.

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.info: Reserved

bits_fields.name: RMVF
bits_fields.info:
Clear reset flag control.
1: Clear the reset flag.
0: No effect.

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.info: Reserved。

bits_fields.name: LSIRDY
bits_fields.info:
Internal Low Speed Clock (LSI) Stable Ready flag bit (set by hardware).
1: Stable internal low-speed clock (128kHz).
0: The internal low-speed clock (128kHz) is not stable.
Note: After the LSION bit is cleared to 0, the bit requires 3 LSI cycles to clear 0.

bits_fields.name: LSION
bits_fields.info:
Internal low-speed clock (LSI) enable control bit.
1: Enable the LSI (128kHz) oscillator.
0: Disable the LSI (128kHz) oscillator.
Note: The Write Clear Reset flag can be cleared except for BIT1 which is cleared by a power-on reset.

bits_fields.name: KEY
bits_fields.info:
Operate the key value lock. 
00xAAAA: Feed the dog. Loading of the IWDG_RLDR register value into the independent watchdog counter. 
0x5555: Allows modification of the R16_IWDG_PSCR and R16_IWDG_ RLDR registers. 
0xCCCC: Start the watchdog, but not if the hardware watchdog is enabled (user-option bytes configuration).

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.info: Reserved

bits_fields.name: PR[2:0]
bits_fields.info:
before modifying this field. 
000: Divided by 4; 001: Divided by 8. 
010: Divided by 16; 011: Divided by 32. 
100: Divided by 64; 101: Divided by 128. 
110: Divided by 256; 111: Divided by 256.  
IWDG counting time base = LSI/divide factor. 
Note: Before reading the value of this field, make 
sure the PVU bit in the IWDG_STATR register is 
0, otherwise the read value is invalid.

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.info: Reserved

bits_fields.name: RL[11:0]
bits_fields.info:
Counter reload value. Write 0x5555 to the KEY before modifying this field. When 0xAAAA is written to the KEY, the value of this field will be loaded into the counter by hardware, and the counter will then count decreasingly from this value. 
Note: Before reading or writing the value of this field, make sure the RVU bit in the IWDG_STATR register is 0, otherwise reading or writing this field is invalid.

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.info: Reserved

bits_fields.name: RL[11:0]
bits_fields.info:
Counter reload value. Write 0x5555 to the KEY before modifying this field. 
When 0xAAAA is written to the KEY, the value of this field will be loaded into the counter by hardware, and the counter will then count decreasingly from this value. 
Note: Before reading or writing the value of this field, make sure the RVU bit in the IWDG_STATR register is 0, otherwise reading or writing this field is invalid.

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.info: Reserved

bits_fields.name: PVU
bits_fields.info:
Clock division factor update flag bit. Hardware set or clear 0. 
1: Clock division value update is in progress. 
0: End of clock division value update (up to 5 LSI cycles). 
Note: The crossover factor register IWDG_PSCR can only be accessed read or write after the PVU bit is cleared to 0.

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.info: Reserved

bits_fields.name: WDGA
bits_fields.info: Window watchdog reset enable bit. 1: Turn on the watchdog function (which generates a reset signal). 0: Disable the watchdog function. Software write 1 is on, but only allows hardware to clear 0 after reset.

bits_fields.name: T[6:0]
bits_fields.info: The 7-bit self-decrement counter decrements by 1 every 4096*2WDGTB HCLK cycles. A watchdog reset is generated when the counter decrements from 0x40 to 0x3F, i.e., when T6 jumps to 0.

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.info: Reserved 0 9 EWI RW1 Early wakeup interrupt enable bit. If this position is 1, an interrupt is generated when the counter value reaches 0x40. This bit can only be invited to 0 by hardware after a reset.

bits_fields.name: WDGTB[1:0]
bits_fields.info: Window watchdog clock division selection. 00: Divided by 1, counting time base = HCLK/4096. 01: Divided by 2, counting time base = HCLK /4096/2. 0 10: Divided by 4, counting time base = HCLK /4096/4. 11: Divided by 8, counting time base = HCLK

bits_fields.name: W[6:0]
bits_fields.info: Window watchdog 7-bit window value. Used to compare with the counter value. The feed dog operation can only be performed when the counter value is less than the window value and greater than 0x3F.

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.info: Reserved

bits_fields.name: EWIF
bits_fields.info: Wake up the interrupt flag bit early. When the counter reaches 0x40, this bit is set in hardware and must be cleared to 0 by software; the user setting is invalid. Even if the EWI is not set, this bit will still be set as usual when the event occurs.

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.info: Reserved

bits_fields.name: Reserved

bits_fields.name: TRx

bits_fields.name: Reserved

bits_fields.name: SWIERx

Setting it here causes the interrupt flag bit (EXTI_INTFR) to correspond to the position bit, and if interrupt enable (EXTI_INTENR) or event enable (EXTI_EVENR) is on, then an interrupt or event will be generated.

bits_fields.name: CNFy[1:0]
bits_fields.info:
(y=0-7), the configuration bits for port x, by which the corresponding port is configured. 

When in input mode (MODE=00b). 
00: Analog input mode. 
01: Floating input mode. 
10: With pull-up and pull-down mode. 
11: Reserved. 

In output mode (MODE>00b). 
00: Universal push-pull output mode. 
01: Universal open-drain output mode. 
10: Multiplexed function push-pull output mode. 
11: Multiplexing function open-drain output mode.

bits_fields.name: MODEy[1:0]
bits_fields.info:
(y=0-7), port x mode selection, configure the corresponding port by these bits. 
00: Input mode. 
01: Output mode, maximum speed 10MHz; 
10: Output mode, maximum speed 2MHz. 
11: Output mode, maximum speed 30MHz.

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.info: Reserved

bits_fields.name: IDRy
bits_fields.info: (y=0-7), the port input data. These bits are readonly and can only be read out in 16-bit form. The value read is the high and low state of the corresponding bit.

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.info: Reserved

bits_fields.name: ODRy
bits_fields.info: For output modes. (y=0-7), the data output by the port. These data can only be operated in 16-bit form. the I/O port outputs the values of these registers externally. For modes with drop-down inputs. 1: Pull-up input; 0: Pull-down input.

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.info: Reserved

bits_fields.name: BRy
bits_fields.info: (y=0-7), the corresponding OUTDR bits are 0 cleared for these location bits, and writing 0 has no effect. These bits can only be accessed in 16-bit form. If both BR and BS bits are set, the BS bit takes effect.

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.info: Reserved

bits_fields.name: BSy
bits_fields.info: (y=0-7), for which the location bits will make the corresponding OUTDR location bits, writing 0 has no effect. These bits can only be accessed in 16-bit form. If both BR and BS bits are set, the BS bit takes effect.

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.info: Reserved

bits_fields.name: BRy
bits_fields.info: (y=0-7), the corresponding OUTDR bits are cleared for these location bits, and writing 0 has no effect. These bits can only be accessed in 16-bit form.

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.description: Reserved

bits_fields.name: LCKK
bits_fields.description:
The lock key, which can be written in a specific sequence to achieve locking, but which can be read out at any time. It reads 0 to indicate that no locking is in effect, and reads 1 to indicate that locking is in effect.
The write sequence for the lock key is: write 1 - write 0 - write 1 - read 0 - read 1. The last step is not necessary, but can be used to confirm that the lock key is active.
Any error while writing the sequence will not enable the activation of the lock and the value of LCK[7:0] cannot be changed while the sequence is being written. After the lock is in effect, the port configuration can only be changed after the next reset.

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.description: Reserved

bits_fields.name: LCKy
bits_fields.description: (y=0-7), these bits are 1 to indicate locking the configuration of the corresponding port. These bits can only be changed before the LCKK is unlocked. The locked configuration refers to the configuration registers GPIOx_CFGLR.

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.info: Reserved

bits_fields.name: SWCFG[2:0]
bits_fields.info: These bits are used to configure the I/O ports for SW function and trace function. SWD (SDI) is the debug interface to access the core. It is always used as a SWD port after system reset.

bits_fields.name: TIM1_IREMAP
I2C1REMAP1
bits_fields.info:
I2C1 remapping high bit (used in conjunction with AFIO_PCFR1 register bit1 I2C1_RM [22,1]). 
00: default mapping (SCL/PC2, SDA/PC1). 
01: Remapping (SCL/ PD1, SDA/PD0). 
1X: Remapping (SCL/PC5, SDA/PC6)

bits_fields.name: USART1_RM1
bits_fields.info:
USART1 mapping configuration high (used in conjunction with AFIO PCFR1 register bit2 USART1RM [21,2]). 
00: default mapping (CK/PD4, TX/PD5, RX/PD6, CTS/PD3, RTS/PC2). 
01: Remapping (CK/PD7, TX/PD0, RX/PD1, CTS/PC3, RTS/PC2, SW_RX/PD0). 
10: Remapping (CK/PD7, TX/PD6, RX/PD5, CTS/PC6, RTS/PC7, SW_RX/PD6). 
11: Remapping (CK/PC5, TX/PC0, RX/PC1, CTS/PC6, RTS/PC7, SW_RX/PC0). 
10: Remapping (CK/PD7, TX/PD6, RX/PD5, CTS/PC6, RTS/PC7, SW_RX/PD6). 
11: Remapping (CK/PC5, TX/PC0, RX/PC1, CTS/PC6, RTS/PC7, SW_RX/PC0).

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.description: Reserved

bits_fields.name: ADC_ETRGREG_RM
ADC_ETRGINJ_RM
Reserved
bits_fields.description: Reserved

bits_fields.name: PA1PA2_RM
Reserved
bits_fields.description: Reserved

bits_fields.name: TIM2_RM[1:0]
bits_fields.description:
Remap bits for timer 2. These bits can be read and written by the user. It controls the mapping of Timer 2's channels 1 through 4 and external trigger (ETR) on the GPIO ports.
00: Default mapping (CH1/ETR/PD4, CH2/PD3, CH3/PC0, CH4/PD7).
01: Partial mapping (CH1/ETR/PC5, CH2/PC2, CH3/PD2, CH4/PC1).
10: Partial mapping (CH1/ETR/PC1, CH2/PD3, CH3/PC0, CH4/PD7).
11: Complete mapping (CH1/ETR/PC1, CH2/PC7, CH3/PD6, CH4/PD5).

bits_fields.name: TIM1_RM[1:0]
bits_fields.description:
Remap bits for timer 1. These bits can be read and written by the user. It controls the mapping of channels 1 to 4, 1N to 3N, external trigger (ETR) and brake input (BKIN) of timer 1 to the GPIO ports.
00: Default mapping (ETR/PC5, CH1/PD2, CH2/PA1, CH3/PC3, CH4/PC4, BKIN/PC2, CH1N/PD0, CH2N/PA2, CH3N/PD1).
01: Partial mapping (ETR/PC5, CH1/PC6, CH2/PC7, CH3/PC0, CH4/PD3, BKIN/PC1, CH1N/PC3, CH2N/PC4, CH3N/PD1).
10: Partial mapping (ETR/PD4, CH1/PD2, CH2/PA1, CH3/PC3, CH4/PC4, BKIN/PC2, CH1N/PD0, CH2N/PA2, CH3N/PD1).
11: Complete mapping (ETR/PC2, CH1/PC4, CH2/PC7, CH3/PC5, CH4/PD4, BKIN/PC1, CH1N/PC3, CH2N/PD2, CH3N/PC6).

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.description: Reserved

bits_fields.name: USART1_RM
bits_fields.description:
USART1 mapping configuration low bit (used in conjunction with AFIO PCFR1 register bit21 USART1REMAP1 [21,2]).
00: Default mapping (CK/PD4, TX/PD5, RX/PD6, CTS/PD3, RTS/PC2).
01: Remapping (CK/PD7, TX/PD0, RX/PD1, CTS/PC3, RTS/PC2, SW_RX/PD0).
10: Remapping (CK/PD7, TX/PD6, RX/PD5, CTS/PC6, RTS/PC7, SW_RX/PD6).
11: Remapping (CK/PC5, TX/PC0, RX/PC1, CTS/PC6, RTS/PC7, SW_RX/PC0).

bits_fields.name: I2C1_RM
bits_fields.description:
I2C1 remapping low bit (used in conjunction with AFIO_PCFR1 register bit22 I2C1_RM1 [22,1]).
00: Default mapping (SCL/PC2, SDA/PC1).
01: Remapping (SCL/ PD1, SDA/ PD0).
1X: Remapping (SCL/PC5, SDA/PC6)

bits_fields.name: SPI1_RM
bits_fields.description:
Remapping of SPI1. This bit can be read or written by the user. It controls the mapping of SPI1's NSS, SCK, MISO, and MOSI multiplexing functions to the GPIO ports.
0: Default mapping (NSS/PC1, CK/PC5, MISO/PC7, MOSI/PC6).
1: Remapping (NSS/PC0, CK/PC5, MISO/PC7, MOSI/PC6).

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.info: Reserved

bits_fields.name: EXTIx[1:0]
bits_fields.info:
(x=0-7), external interrupt input pin configuration bit. Used to determine to which port pins the external interrupt pins are mapped. 
00: xth pin of the PA pin. 
10: xth pin of the PC pin. 
11: xth pin of the PD pin.

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.info: Reserved

bits_fields.name: MEM2MEM
bits_fields.info: Memory-to-memory mode enable. 1: Enable memory-to-memory data transfer mode. 0: Disable memory-to-memory data transfer mode.

bits_fields.name: PL
bits_fields.info: Channel priority setting. 00: low; 01: medium. 10: High; 11:Very high.

bits_fields.name: MSIZE
bits_fields.info: Memory address data width setting. 00: 8 bits; 01: 16 bits. 10: 32 bits; 11: Reserved.

bits_fields.name: PSIZE
bits_fields.info: Peripheral address data width setting. 00: 8 bits; 01: 16 bits. 10: 32 bits; 11: Reserved.

bits_fields.name: MINC
bits_fields.description:
Memory address incremental mode enable.
1: Enable incremental memory address increment operation.
0: Memory address remains unchanged operation.

bits_fields.name: PINC
bits_fields.description:
Peripheral address incremental mode enable.
1: Enable incremental operation of the peripheral address.
0: Peripheral address remains unchanged operation.

bits_fields.name: CIRC
bits_fields.description:
DMA channel cyclic mode enable.
1: Enables cyclic operation.
0: Perform a single operation.

bits_fields.name: DIR
bits_fields.description:
Data transfer direction.
1: Read from memory.
0: Read from peripheral.

bits_fields.name: TEIE
bits_fields.description:
Transmission error interrupt enable control.
1: Enable transmission error interrupt.
0: Disable transmission error interrupt.

bits_fields.name: HTIE
bits_fields.description:
Transmission over half interrupt enable control.
1: Enable the transmission over half interrupt.
0: Disable the transmission over half interrupt.

bits_fields.name: TCIE
bits_fields.description:
Transmission completion interrupt enable control.
1: Enable the transmission completion interrupt.
0: Disable the transmission completion interrupt.

bits_fields.name: EN
bits_fields.description:
Channel enable control.
1: Channel on; 0: Channel off.
When a DMA transfer error occurs, the hardware automatically clears this bit to 0 and shuts down the channel.

R32_DMA_CNTRx.name: R32_DMA_CNTR1
R32_DMA_CNTRx.info: 0x4002000C DMA channel 1 number of data register

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.info: Reserved

bits_fields.name: NDT[15:0]
bits_fields.info:
Number of data transfers, range 0-65535. 
This register can only be written when the channel is not operating (EN=0 for DMA_CFGRx). After the channel is turned on this register becomes read-only and indicates the number of remaining pending transfer (the register content is decremented after each DMA transfer). 
When the channel is in cyclic mode, the contents of the register will be automatically reloaded to the previously configured value.

bits_fields.name: PA[31:0]
bits_fields.info:
Peripheral base address, which serves as the source or destination address for peripheral data transfer. 
When PSIZE[1:0]='01' (16 bits), the module automatically ignores bit0 and the operation address is automatically 2byte aligned; when PSIZE[1:0]='10' (32 bits), the module automatically ignores bit[1:0] and the operation address is automatically 4-byte aligned.

bits_fields.name: MA[31:0]
bits_fields.info:
The memory data address, which serves as the source or destination address for data transfers. 
When MSIZE[1:0]='01' (16 bits), the module automatically ignores bit0, and the operation address is automatically 2-byte aligned; when MSIZE[1:0]='10' (32 bits), the module automatically ignores bit[1:0], and the operation address is automatically 4-byte aligned.

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.description: Reserved

bits_fields.name: TEIFx
bits_fields.description:
Transmission error flag for channel x (x=1/2/3/4/5/6/7).
1: A transmission error occurred on channel x.
0: No transmission error on channel x.
Hardware set, software write CTEIFx bit to clear this flag.

bits_fields.name: HTIFx
bits_fields.description:
Transmission halfway flag for channel x (x=1/2/3/4/5/6/7).
1: a transmission over half event is generated on channel x.
0: No transmission over half on channel x.
Hardware set, software write CHTIFx bit to clear this flag.

bits_fields.name: TCIFx
bits_fields.description:
Transmission completion flag for channel x (x=1/2/3/4/5/6/7).
1: a transmission completion event is generated on channel x.
0: No transmission completion event on channel x.
Hardware set, software write CTCIFx bit to clear this flag.

bits_fields.name: GIFx
bits_fields.description:
Global interrupt flag for channel x (x=1/2/3/4/5/6/7).
1: TEIFx or HTIFx or TCIFx is generated on channel x.
0: No TEIFx or HTIFx or TCIFx occurred on channel x.
Hardware set, software write CGIFx bit to clear this flag.

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.info: Reserved

bits_fields.name: CTEIFx
bits_fields.info: Clear the transmission error flag for channel x (x=1/2/3/4/5/6/7). 1: Clear the TEIFx flag in the DMA_INTFR register. 0: No effect.

bits_fields.name: CHTIFx
bits_fields.info: Clear the transmission halfway flag for channel x (x=1/2/3/4/5/6/7). 1: Clear the HTIFx flag in the DMA_INTFR register. 0: No effect.

bits_fields.name: CTCIFx
bits_fields.info: Clear the transmission completion flag for channel x (x=1/2/3/4/5/6/7). 1: Clear the TCIFx flag in the DMA_INTFR register. 0: No effect.

bits_fields.name: CGIFx
bits_fields.info: Clear the global interrupt flag for channel x (x=1/2/3/4/5/6/7). 1: Clear the TEIFx/HTIFx/TCIFx/ GIFx flags in the DMA_INTFR register. 0: No effect.

R32_DMA_CNTR1.name: R32_DMA_CNTR1
R32_DMA_CNTR1.info: 0x4002000C DMA channel 1 number of data register

R32_DMA_CNTR2.info: DMA channel 2 number of data register

R32_DMA_CNTR3.info: DMA channel 3 number of data register

R32_DMA_CNTR4.name: R32_DMA_CNTR4
R32_DMA_CNTR4.info: DMA channel 4 number of data register

R32_DMA_CNTR5.name: R32_DMA_CNTR5
R32_DMA_CNTR5.info: DMA channel 5 number of data register

R32_ADC_IOFRx.name: R32_ADC_IOFR1
R32_ADC_IOFRx.info: ADC injected channel data offset register 1

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.info: Reserved

bits_fields.name: JOFFSETx[11:0]
bits_fields.info: Data offset value for injected channel x. When converting injected channels, this value is subtracted from the original conversion data. The result can be read in ADC_IDATARx register.

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.info: Reserved

bits_fields.name: JDATA[15:0]
bits_fields.info: Injection channel conversion data (data left- aligned or right-aligned).

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.info: Reserved

bits_fields.name: STRT
bits_fields.info: Rule channel transition start state. 1: Rule channel conversion has started. 0: Rule channel conversion has not started. This bit is set to 1 by hardware and cleared to 0 by software (write 1 is not valid).

bits_fields.name: JSTRT
bits_fields.info: Injection channel conversion start state. 1: Injection channel conversion has started. 0: Injection channel conversion has not started. This bit is set to 1 by hardware and cleared to 0 by software (write 1 is not valid).

bits_fields.name: JEOC
bits_fields.info: End state of the injection channel group conversion. 1: Conversion complete. 0: Conversion not completed. This bit is set to 1 by hardware (all injected channels converted) and cleared to 0 by software (write 1 is invalid).

bits_fields.name: EOC
bits_fields.info: Conversion end state. 1: Conversion complete. 0: Conversion not completed. This bit is set to 1 by hardware (end of rule or injection channel group conversion), and cleared to 0 by software or when reading ADC_RDATAR.

bits_fields.name: AWD
bits_fields.info: Analog watchdog flag bit. 1: Analog watchdog event occurred. 0: No analog watchdog event occurred. This bit is set to 1 by hardware (conversion value is out of range of ADC_WDHTR and ADC_WDLTR) and cleared to 0 by software (write 1 is invalid).

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.info: Reserved

bits_fields.name: CALVOL[1:0]
bits_fields.info: Calibration voltage selection. 01: Calibration voltage 2/4 AVDD. 10: Calibration voltage 3/4 AVDD. Other: Invalid.

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.info: Reserved

bits_fields.name: AWDEN
bits_fields.info: Analog watchdog function enable bit on the rule channel. 1: Enable. 0: Disable.

bits_fields.name: JAWDEN
bits_fields.info: Analog watchdog function enable bit on the injection channel. 1: Enable. 0: Disable.

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.info: Reserved

bits_fields.name: DISCNUM[2:0]
bits_fields.info: Number of rule channels to be converted after external triggering in intermittent mode. 000: 1 channel. ... 111: 8 channels.

bits_fields.name: JDISCEN
bits_fields.info: Intermittent mode enable bit on the injection channel. 1: Enable; 0: Disable.

bits_fields.name: DISCEN
bits_fields.info: Intermittent mode enable bit on the rule channel. 1: Enable; 0: Disable.

bits_fields.name: JAUTO
bits_fields.info: After opening of the rule channel is completed, the injection channel group enable bit is switched automatically. 1: Enable automatic group switching. 0: Disable automatic group switching.

bits_fields.name: AWDSGL
bits_fields.info: In scan mode, use the analog watchdog on a single channel. 1: Use analog watchdog on a single channel (AWDCH[4:0] selection). 0: Use on all channels.

bits_fields.name: SCAN
bits_fields.info: Scan mode enable bit. 1: Enable scan mode. 0: Disable scan mode.

bits_fields.name: JEOCIE
bits_fields.info: Inject the channel group end-of-conversion interrupt enable bit. 1: Enable group completion interrupt. 0: Disable group completion interrupt.

bits_fields.name: AWDIE
bits_fields.info: Analog watchdog interrupt enable bit. 1: Enable. 0: Disable. Note: In scan mode, this interrupt will abort the scan if it occurs.

bits_fields.name: EOCIE
bits_fields.info: End of conversion (rule or injection channel group) interrupt enable bit. 1: Enable. 0: Disable.

bits_fields.name: AWDCH[4:0]
bits_fields.info: Analog watchdog channel selection bits. 00000: channel 0; 00001: channel 1; ... 01001: channel 9.

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.info: Reserved

bits_fields.name: SWSTART
bits_fields.info: Software trigger to start rule channel conversion. 1: Initiate conversion. 0: Reset state. Set by software; cleared by hardware when conversion starts.

bits_fields.name: JSWSTART
bits_fields.info: Software trigger to start injection channel conversion. 1: Initiate injection channel conversion. 0: Reset state. Set by software; cleared to 0 by hardware or software when conversion starts.

bits_fields.name: EXTTRIG
bits_fields.info: External trigger mode enable for the rule channel. 1: Use external events to initiate conversions. 0: Disable external event activation.

bits_fields.name: EXTSEL[2:0]
bits_fields.info: External trigger event selection for initiating rule channel conversion. 000: TRGO (Timer1). 001: CC1 (Timer1). 010: CC2 (Timer1). 011: TRGO (Timer2). 100: CC1 (Timer2). 101: CC2 (Timer2). 110: PD3/PC2. 111: SWSTART software trigger.

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.info: Reserved

bits_fields.name: JEXTTRIG
bits_fields.info: External trigger mode enable for the injected channel. 1: Use external events to initiate conversions. 0: Disable external event activation.

bits_fields.name: JEXTSEL[2:0]
bits_fields.info: External trigger event selection for initiating injection channel conversion. 000: CC3 (Timer1); 001: CC4 (Timer1); 010: CC3 (Timer2); 011: CC4 (Timer2); 100–101: Reserved; 110: PD1/PA2; 111: JSWSTART software trigger.

bits_fields.name: ALIGN
bits_fields.info: Data alignment control. 1: Left-aligned. 0: Right-aligned.

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.info: Reserved

bits_fields.name: DMA
bits_fields.info: Direct Memory Access mode enable. 1: Enable DMA. 0: Disable DMA.

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.info: Reserved

bits_fields.name: RSTCAL
bits_fields.info: Reset calibration bit. Set by software; cleared by hardware after reset completes. 1: Initialize calibration registers. 0: Calibration register initialized. Note: Setting this while conversion is active may require extra cycles to clear.

bits_fields.name: CAL
bits_fields.info: Start calibration. 1: Start calibration. 0: Calibration complete. Set by software; cleared by hardware at the end of calibration.

bits_fields.name: CONT
bits_fields.info: Continuous conversion enable. 1: Continuous conversion mode. 0: Single conversion mode. Conversion continues until cleared.

bits_fields.name: ADON
bits_fields.info: ADC enable and start control. 1: Turn on ADC and start conversion. 0: Power down ADC. Writing 1 when ADON=0 wakes ADC from power-down; writing 1 when ADON=1 starts conversion.

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.info: Reserved

bits_fields.name: SMPx[2:0]
bits_fields.info: Sample time configuration for channel x. 000: 3 cycles; 001: 9 cycles; 010: 15 cycles; 011: 30 cycles; 100: 43 cycles; 101: 57 cycles; 110: 73 cycles; 111: 241 cycles. Used to independently select the sample time for each channel; the configuration value must remain constant during sampling.

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.info: Reserved

bits_fields.name: SMPx[2:0]
bits_fields.info: Sample time configuration for channel x. 000: 3 cycles; 001: 9 cycles; 010: 15 cycles; 011: 30 cycles; 100: 43 cycles; 101: 57 cycles; 110: 73 cycles; 111: 241 cycles. Used to independently select the sample time for each channel; the configuration value must remain constant during the sample cycle.

R32_ADC_IOFR1.name: R32_ADC_IOFR1
R32_ADC_IOFR1.info: ADC injected channel data offset register 1

R32_ADC_IOFR2.name: R32_ADC_IOFR2
R32_ADC_IOFR2.info: ADC injected channel data offset register 2

R32_ADC_IOFR3.name: R32_ADC_IOFR3
R32_ADC_IOFR3.info: ADC injected channel data offset register 3

R32_ADC_IOFR4.name: R32_ADC_IOFR4
R32_ADC_IOFR4.info: ADC injected channel data offset register 4

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.info: Reserved

bits_fields.name: HT[9:0]
bits_fields.info: Analog watchdog high threshold setting value.

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.info: Reserved

bits_fields.name: LT[9:0]
bits_fields.info: Analog watchdog low threshold setting value.

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.info: Reserved

bits_fields.name: L[3:0]
bits_fields.info: Number of channels to be converted in a regular channel conversion sequence. 0000–1111: 1–16 conversions.

bits_fields.name: SQ16[4:0]
bits_fields.info: The number of the 16th conversion channel in the rule sequence (0–9).

bits_fields.name: SQ15[4:0]
bits_fields.info: The number of the 15th conversion channel in the rule sequence (0–9).

bits_fields.name: SQ14[4:0]
bits_fields.info: The number of the 14th conversion channel in the rule sequence (0–9).

bits_fields.name: SQ13[4:0]
bits_fields.info: The number of the 13th conversion channel in the rule sequence (0–9).

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.info: Reserved

bits_fields.name: SQ12[4:0]
bits_fields.info: The number of the 12th conversion channel in the rule sequence (0–9).

bits_fields.name: SQ11[4:0]
bits_fields.info: The number of the 11th conversion channel in the rule sequence (0–9).

bits_fields.name: SQ10[4:0]
bits_fields.info: The number of the 10th conversion channel in the rule sequence (0–9).

bits_fields.name: SQ9[4:0]
bits_fields.info: The number of the 9th conversion channel in the rule sequence (0–9).

bits_fields.name: SQ8[4:0]
bits_fields.info: The number of the 8th conversion channel in the rule sequence (0–9).

bits_fields.name: SQ7[4:0]
bits_fields.info: The number of the 7th conversion channel in the rule sequence (0–9).

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.info: Reserved

bits_fields.name: SQ6[4:0]
bits_fields.info: The number of the 6th conversion channel in the rule sequence (0–9).

bits_fields.name: SQ5[4:0]
bits_fields.info: The number of the 5th conversion channel in the rule sequence (0–9).

bits_fields.name: SQ4[4:0]
bits_fields.info: The number of the 4th conversion channel in the rule sequence (0–9).

bits_fields.name: SQ3[4:0]
bits_fields.info: The number of the 3rd conversion channel in the rule sequence (0–9).

bits_fields.name: SQ2[4:0]
bits_fields.info: The number of the 2nd conversion channel in the rule sequence (0–9).

bits_fields.name: SQ1[4:0]
bits_fields.info: The number of the 1st conversion channel in the rule sequence (0–9).

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.info: Reserved

bits_fields.name: JL[1:0]
bits_fields.info: Inject the number of channels to be converted in the channel conversion sequence. 00- 11: 1-4 conversions.

bits_fields.name: JSQ4[4:0]
bits_fields.info: The number of the 4th conversion channel in the injection sequence (0-9). Note : The software writes and assigns the channel number (0-9) as the 4th in the sequence to be converted.

bits_fields.name: JSQ3[4:0]
bits_fields.info: The number of the 3rd conversion channel in the injection sequence (0-9).

bits_fields.name: JSQ2[4:0]
bits_fields.info: The number of the 2nd conversion channel in the injection sequence (0-9).

bits_fields.name: JSQ1[4:0]
bits_fields.info: The number of the 1st conversion channel in the injection sequence (0-9).

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.info: Reserved

bits_fields.name: DATA[15:0]
bits_fields.info: Rule channel conversion data (data left-aligned or right aligned)

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.info: Reserved

bits_fields.name: DLYSRC
bits_fields.info: External trigger source delay selection 1: Injection channel external trigger delay; 0: Rule channel external trigger delay.

bits_fields.name: DLYVLU[8:0]
bits_fields.info: External trigger delay data, delay time configuration, unit : ADC clock cycle

bits_fields.name: CAPLVL
bits_fields.info: In double-edge capture mode, enables capture level indication. 1: Enable the indication function; 0: Disable. When enabled, bit[16] of CHxCVR indicates the level corresponding to the capture value.

bits_fields.name: CAPOV
bits_fields.info: Capture value mode configuration. 1: CHxCVR is 0xFFFF if counter overflow occurred before capture; 0: capture value reflects the actual counter.

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.info: Reserved

bits_fields.name: CKD[1:0]
bits_fields.info: Division ratio for timer clock (CK_INT), dead-time, and digital filter clock. 00: Tdts=Tck_int; 01: Tdts=2xTck_int; 10: Tdts=4xTck_int; 11: Reserved.

bits_fields.name: ARPE
bits_fields.info: Auto-reload preload enable bit. 1: Enable Automatic Reload Value Register (ATRLR); 0: ATRLR disabled.

bits_fields.name: CMS[1:0]
bits_fields.info: Central alignment mode selection. 00: Edge-aligned; 01: Central alignment mode 1; 10: Central alignment mode 2; 11: Central alignment mode 3.

bits_fields.name: DIR
bits_fields.info: Counting direction. 1: Down-counting; 0: Up-counting. Not valid in central alignment or encoder mode.

bits_fields.name: OPM
bits_fields.info: Single pulse mode. 1: Counter stops (clearing CEN) at next update event; 0: counter does not stop.

bits_fields.name: URS
bits_fields.info: Update request source. 1: Only generate interrupt/DMA request on overflow/underflow; 0: Generate on overflow/underflow, UG bit set, or slave mode updates.

bits_fields.name: UDIS
bits_fields.info: Update disable. 1: UEV disabled, no update event generated, registers hold value; 0: UEV allowed, updates load register cache values.

bits_fields.name: CEN
bits_fields.info: Counter enable. 1: Enable counter; 0: Disable counter. Required for external clock, gated, and encoder modes.

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.info: Reserved

bits_fields.name: OIS4
bits_fields.info: Output idle state 4. 1: If MOE=0 and OC4N is implemented, OC4=1 after dead-time; 0: OC4=0 after dead-time. Cannot be modified after LOCK (TIMx_BDTR) level 1, 2 or 3.

bits_fields.name: OIS3N
bits_fields.info: Output idle state 3N. 1: If MOE=0, OC3N=1 after dead-time; 0: OC3N=0. Cannot be modified after LOCK set.

bits_fields.name: OIS3
bits_fields.info: Output idle state 3. Same as OIS4.

bits_fields.name: OIS2N
bits_fields.info: Output idle state 2N. Same as OIS3N.

bits_fields.name: OIS2
bits_fields.info: Output idle state 2. Same as OIS4.

bits_fields.name: OIS1N
bits_fields.info: Output idle state 1N. Same as OIS3N.

bits_fields.name: OIS1
bits_fields.info: Output idle state 1. Same as OIS4.

bits_fields.name: TI1S
bits_fields.info: TI1 input selection. 1: TIMx_CH1, CH2, CH3 pins connected to TI1 after heterodyning; 0: only CH1 connected to TI1.

bits_fields.name: MMS[2:0]
bits_fields.info: Master mode selection for TRGO signal. 000: Use UG bit from TIMx_EGR for TRGO. 001: Counter enable (CNT_EN) as TRGO. 010: Update event as TRGO. 011: Compare pulse on CC1IF for TRGO. 100: OC1REF signal as TRGO. 101: OC2REF as TRGO. 110: OC3REF as TRGO. 111: OC4REF as TRGO.

bits_fields.name: CCDS
bits_fields.info: Capture/compare DMA selection. 1: DMA request for CHxCVR on update event; 0: DMA on CHxCVR.

bits_fields.name: CCUS
bits_fields.info: Compare/capture update selection. 1: If CCPC set, can update via COM bit or rising TRGI; 0: Only COM bit. Applies to channels with complementary outputs.

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.info: Reserved

bits_fields.name: CCPC
bits_fields.info: Compare capture preload control. 1: CCxE, CCxNE, OCxM bits are preloaded and updated on COM bit set; 0: not preloaded. Applies to channels with complementary outputs.

bits_fields.name: ETP
bits_fields.info: ETR trigger polarity selection. 1: Invert ETR, low/falling edge active; 0: ETR active high/rising edge.

bits_fields.name: ECE
bits_fields.info: External clock mode 2 enable. 1: Enable external clock mode 2. 0: Disable. Slave mode can be used simultaneously, but TRGI can't be connected to ETRF in this case (TS cannot be '111'). If both external clock modes enabled, the external clock input is ETRF.

bits_fields.name: ETPS[1:0]
bits_fields.info: External trigger prescaler. 00: Off; 01: ETRP÷2; 10: ETRP÷4; 11: ETRP÷8. ETRP frequency cannot exceed 1/4 TIM1CLK max.

bits_fields.name: ETF[3:0]
bits_fields.info: External trigger digital filter config: 0001: Fsampling=Fck_int, N=2; 0010: Fck_int, N=4; 0011: Fck_int, N=8; 0100: Fdts/2, N=6; 0101: Fdts/2, N=8; 0110: Fdts/4, N=6; 0111: Fdts/4, N=8; 1000: Fdts/8, N=6; 1001: Fdts/8, N=8; 1010: Fdts/16, N=5; 1011: Fdts/16, N=6; 1100: Fdts/16, N=8; 1101: Fdts/32, N=5; 1110: Fdts/32, N=6; 1111: Fdts/32, N=8.

bits_fields.name: MSM
bits_fields.info: Master/slave mode selection. 1: Event on TRGI is delayed for synchronization. 0: Disabled.

bits_fields.name: TS[2:0]
bits_fields.info: Trigger selection. 000: ITR0; 001: ITR1; 010: ITR2; 011: ITR3; 100: TI1F_ED; 101: TI1FP1; 110: TI2FP2; 111: ETRF. Only changes when SMS=0.

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.info: Reserved

bits_fields.name: SMS[2:0]
bits_fields.info: Slave mode selection. 000: Internal clock; 001: Encoder mode 1; 010: Encoder mode 2; 011: Encoder mode 3; 100: Reset mode; 101: Gated mode; 110: Trigger mode; 111: External clock mode 1.

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.info: Reserved

bits_fields.name: TDE
bits_fields.info: Trigger DMA request enable bit. 1: Enable trigger DMA request; 0: Disable trigger DMA request.

bits_fields.name: COMDE
bits_fields.info: COM's DMA request enable bit. 1: Enable COM DMA request; 0: Disable.

bits_fields.name: CC4DE
bits_fields.info: DMA request enable bit for compare/capture channel 4. 1: Enable; 0: Disable.

bits_fields.name: CC3DE
bits_fields.info: DMA request enable bit for compare/capture channel 3. 1: Enable; 0: Disable.

bits_fields.name: CC2DE
bits_fields.info: DMA request enable bit for compare/capture channel 2. 1: Enable; 0: Disable.

bits_fields.name: CC1DE
bits_fields.info: DMA request enable bit for compare/capture channel 1. 1: Enable; 0: Disable.

bits_fields.name: UDE
bits_fields.info: Update DMA request enable bit. 1: Enable updated DMA request; 0: Disable.

bits_fields.name: BIE
bits_fields.info: Brake interrupt enable bit. 1: Enable brake interrupt; 0: Disable.

bits_fields.name: TIE
bits_fields.info: Trigger interrupt enable bit. 1: Enable trigger interrupt; 0: Disable.

bits_fields.name: COMIE
bits_fields.info: COM interrupt enable bit. 1: Enable COM interrupt; 0: Disable.

bits_fields.name: CC4IE
bits_fields.info: Compare/capture channel 4 interrupt enable bit. 1: Enable; 0: Disable.

bits_fields.name: CC3IE
bits_fields.info: Compare/capture channel 3 interrupt enable bit. 1: Enable; 0: Disable.

bits_fields.name: CC2IE
bits_fields.info: Compare/capture channel 2 interrupt enable bit. 1: Enable; 0: Disable.

bits_fields.name: CC1IE
bits_fields.info: Compare/capture channel 1 interrupt enable bit. 1: Enable; 0: Disable.

bits_fields.name: UIE
bits_fields.info: Update interrupt enable bit. 1: Enable updated interrupt; 0: Disable.

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.info: Reserved

bits_fields.name: CC4OF
bits_fields.info: Compare/capture channel 4 overcapture flag. Set by hardware on overcapture (input capture mode). Cleared by software write 0.

bits_fields.name: CC3OF
bits_fields.info: Compare/capture channel 3 overcapture flag. Set by hardware on overcapture (input capture mode). Cleared by software write 0.

bits_fields.name: CC2OF
bits_fields.info: Compare/capture channel 2 overcapture flag. Set by hardware on overcapture (input capture mode). Cleared by software write 0.

bits_fields.name: CC1OF
bits_fields.info: Compare/capture channel 1 overcapture flag. Set by hardware on overcapture (input capture mode). Cleared by software write 0. 1: Counter value captured when CC1IF set. 0: No duplicate capture.

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.info: Reserved

bits_fields.name: BIF
bits_fields.info: Brake interrupt flag. Set by hardware on valid brake input. Cleared by software.

bits_fields.name: TIF
bits_fields.info: Trigger interrupt flag. Set by hardware on trigger event; cleared by software.

bits_fields.name: COMIF
bits_fields.info: COM event interrupt flag. Set by hardware on COM event; cleared by software.

bits_fields.name: CC4IF
bits_fields.info: Compare/capture channel 4 interrupt flag. Set by hardware; cleared by software.

bits_fields.name: CC3IF
bits_fields.info: Compare/capture channel 3 interrupt flag. Set by hardware; cleared by software.

bits_fields.name: CC2IF
bits_fields.info: Compare/capture channel 2 interrupt flag. Set by hardware; cleared by software.

bits_fields.name: CC1IF
bits_fields.info: Compare/capture channel 1 interrupt flag (output mode: set when counter matches compare value except center-aligned; input mode: set on input capture). Cleared by software.

bits_fields.name: UIF
bits_fields.info: Update interrupt flag. Set by hardware when update event generated; cleared by software. 1: Update interrupt generation; 0: No update event.

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.info: Reserved

bits_fields.name: BG
bits_fields.info: Brake event generation bit. Set/cleared by software to generate a brake event. 1: Generate brake event (MOE=0, BIF=1, and corresponding interrupt/DMA generated if enabled); 0: No action.

bits_fields.name: TG
bits_fields.info: Trigger event generation bit. Set by software, cleared by hardware. 1: Generate trigger event; 0: No action.

bits_fields.name: COMG
bits_fields.info: Compare capture control update generation bit. Set by software, cleared by hardware. 1: If CCPC=1, allows updating CCxE, CCxNE, OCxM bits; 0: No action. Valid only for channels with complementary outputs (channels 1–3).

bits_fields.name: CC4G
bits_fields.info: Compare capture event generation bit 4. Set by software to generate compare capture event 4.

bits_fields.name: CC3G
bits_fields.info: Compare capture event generation bit 3. Set by software to generate compare capture event 3.

bits_fields.name: CC2G
bits_fields.info: Compare capture event generation bit 2. Set by software to generate compare capture event 2.

bits_fields.name: CC1G
bits_fields.info: Compare capture event generation bit 1. Set by software to generate compare capture event 1. If output mode: Set CC1IF and generate interrupts/DMAs if enabled. If input mode: Counter value captured to compare capture register 1; CC1IF set; interrupts/DMAs if enabled; if CC1IF was already set, also set CC1OF. 0: No action.

bits_fields.name: UG
bits_fields.info: Update event generation bit. Set by software, cleared by hardware. 1: Initialize counter and generate update event (prescaler counter cleared, core counter cleared in edge/center mode, reload value in decremental mode); 0: No action.

bits_fields.name: OC2CE
bits_fields.info: Compare capture channel 2 clear enable bit. 1: Clear OC2REF bit zero once ETRF input is detected high; 0: OC2REF not affected by ETRF input.

bits_fields.name: OC2M[2:0]
bits_fields.info: Compare capture channel 2 mode field. 000: Freeze. 001: Force set. 010: Force clear. 011: Toggle. 100: Forced clear. 101: Forced set. 110: PWM Mode 1. 111: PWM Mode 2. Defines OC2REF signal action at channel 2 output.

bits_fields.name: OC2PE
bits_fields.info: Compare capture register 2 preload enable. 1: Preload enabled, register loaded at update; 0: Register writable any time. Not mutable if LOCK=3 and CC2S=00; PWM only in OPM=1 without enabling preload.

bits_fields.name: OC2FE
bits_fields.info: Compare capture channel 2 fast enable. 1: Reduced latency to 3 cycles for compare output on trigger, only in PWM1/PWM2; 0: Default latency (5 cycles).

bits_fields.name: CC2S[1:0]
bits_fields.info: Channel 2 input selection. 00: Output; 01: Input (IC2 mapped to TI2); 10: Input (IC2 mapped to TI1); 11: Input (IC2 mapped to TRC; only with TS select).

bits_fields.name: OC1CE
bits_fields.info: Compare capture channel 1 clear enable bit.

bits_fields.name: OC1M[2:0]
bits_fields.info: Compare capture channel 1 mode field. Same options as OC2M[2:0]: 000: Freeze; 001: Force set; 010: Force clear; 011: Toggle; 100: Forced clear; 101: Forced set; 110: PWM1; 111: PWM2.

bits_fields.name: OC1PE
bits_fields.info: Compare capture register 1 preload enable bit.

bits_fields.name: OC1FE
bits_fields.info: Compare capture channel 1 fast enable bit.

bits_fields.name: CC1S[1:0]
bits_fields.info: Compare capture channel 1 input selection.

bits_fields2.name: IC2F[3:0]
bits_fields2.info: Input capture filter for channel 2. Sets the sampling frequency and filter length: 0000: no filter, sampled at fDTS; 0001: Fck_int, N=2; 0010: Fck_int, N=4; 0011: Fck_int, N=8; 0100: Fdts/2, N=6; 0101: Fdts/2, N=8; 0110: Fdts/4, N=6; 0111: Fdts/4, N=8; 1000: Fdts/8, N=6; 1001: Fdts/8, N=8; 1010: Fdts/16, N=5; 1011: Fdts/16, N=6; 1100: Fdts/16, N=8; 1101: Fdts/32, N=5; 1110: Fdts/32, N=6; 1111: Fdts/32, N=8.

bits_fields2.name: IC2PSC[1:0]
bits_fields2.info: Compare capture channel 2 prescaler. 00: no prescaler (capture every edge); 01: capture every 2 events; 10: every 4 events; 11: every 8 events. Reset when CC2E=0.

bits_fields2.name: CC2S[1:0]
bits_fields2.info: Compare/capture channel 2 input selection. 00: output; 01: input, IC2 on TI2; 10: input, IC2 on TI1; 11: input, IC2 on TRC (works only with TS input selected). Writable only when CC2E=0.

bits_fields2.name: IC1F[3:0]
bits_fields2.info: Input capture filter for channel 1. Codes same as IC2F[3:0].

bits_fields2.name: IC1PSC[1:0]
bits_fields2.info: Compare capture channel 1 prescaler. 00: no prescaler; 01: capture every 2 events; 10: every 4 events; 11: every 8 events.

bits_fields2.name: CC1S[1:0]
bits_fields2.info: Compare capture channel 1 input selection fields (same encoding as for CC2S[1:0]).

bits_fields.name: OC4CE
bits_fields.info: Compare capture channel 4 clear enable bit.

bits_fields.name: OC4M[2:0]
bits_fields.info: Compare capture channel 4 mode setting field. 000: Freeze; 001: Force set; 010: Force clear; 011: Toggle; 100: Force inactive; 101: Force active; 110: PWM1; 111: PWM2.

bits_fields.name: OC4PE
bits_fields.info: Compare Capture Register 4 preload enable bit.

bits_fields.name: OC4FE
bits_fields.info: Compare capture channel 4 fast enable bit.

bits_fields.name: CC4S[1:0]
bits_fields.info: Compare capture channel 4 input selection fields.

bits_fields.name: OC3CE
bits_fields.info: Compare capture channel 3 clear enable bit.

bits_fields.name: OC3M[2:0]
bits_fields.info: Compare capture channel 3 mode setting field. 000: Freeze; 001: Force set; 010: Force clear; 011: Toggle; 100: Force inactive; 101: Force active; 110: PWM1; 111: PWM2.

bits_fields.name: OC3PE
bits_fields.info: Compare Capture Register 3 preload enable bit.

bits_fields.name: OC3FE
bits_fields.info: Compare capture channel 3 fast enable bit.

bits_fields.name: CC3S[1:0]
bits_fields.info: Compare capture channel 3 input selection fields.

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.info: Reserved

bits_fields.name: CC4P
bits_fields.info: Compare/capture channel 4 output polarity. 1: OC4 active low; 0: OC4 active high. With input: 1 = inverted trigger/capture; 0 = non-inverted.

bits_fields.name: CC4E
bits_fields.info: Compare/capture channel 4 output enable bit. 1: OC4 enabled/capture enabled; 0: output/capture disabled.

bits_fields.name: CC3NP
bits_fields.info: Compare/capture channel 3 complementary output polarity bit.

bits_fields.name: CC3NE
bits_fields.info: Compare/capture channel 3 complementary output enable bit.

bits_fields.name: CC3P
bits_fields.info: Compare/capture channel 3 output polarity. 1: OC3 active low; 0: OC3 active high. With input: 1 = inverted trigger/capture; 0 = non-inverted.

bits_fields.name: CC3E
bits_fields.info: Compare/capture channel 3 output enable bit.

bits_fields.name: CC2NP
bits_fields.info: Compare/capture channel 2 complementary output polarity bit.

bits_fields.name: CC2NE
bits_fields.info: Compare/capture channel 2 complementary output enable bit.

bits_fields.name: CC2P
bits_fields.info: Compare/capture channel 2 output polarity. 1: OC2 active low; 0: OC2 active high. With input: 1 = inverted trigger/capture; 0 = non-inverted.

bits_fields.name: CC2E
bits_fields.info: Compare/capture channel 2 output enable bit.

bits_fields.name: CC1NP
bits_fields.info: Compare/capture channel 1 complementary output polarity bit.

bits_fields.name: CC1NE
bits_fields.info: Compare/capture channel 1 complementary output enable bit.

bits_fields.name: CC1P
bits_fields.info: Compare/capture channel 1 output polarity. Output: 1=active low, 0=active high. Input: 1=inverted/falling, 0=non-inverted/rising.

bits_fields.name: CC1E
bits_fields.info: Compare/capture channel 1 output or capture enable bit. Output: 1=OC1 enabled, 0=disabled. Input: 1=capture enabled, 0=disabled.

bits_fields.name: CNT[15:0]
bits_fields.info: The real-time value of the timer's counter.
